topic.title: Test ol and ul
topic.shortdesc: Testing the attributes on a UL and on an OL

body.p: First, test @outputclass on ul, ol, li, itemgroup:
body.section:
Lists inside paragraphsHere is a compact OL:
compact
OL
goes
here And here is a non-compact UL:
non-compact
UL
goes
here

section.title: Conref tests
section.p: Now conref list items into the ul:

ul.li: Should not appear: pull li from ul
Should not appear: pull li from ol

section.p: Now conref list items into the ol:

ol.li: Should not appear: pull li from ul
Should not appear: pull li from ol

topic.title: Testing ordered list
topic.shortdesc: This should test placing anything I can inside of an LI.

ol.li: Testing everything in a list item: need to test PCDATA, basic.ph, basic.block, itemgroup, txt.incl

test apiname test bold (test boolean ->) test cmdname test codeph test filepath test italic test keyword test menucascade/uicontrol test msgnum test msgph test option test parmname test ph testing a quote (test state => ) test sub test sup test synph test systemoutput test term test tt test underlined test uicontrol test uicontrol/shortcut test userinput test varname test wintitle test cite test xref test tm
footnote: This is a footnote, which is part of txt.incltxt.incl index term

table.title: testing a table in an example

li.screen: screens keep out the bugs and let in the birds

li.pre: test pre test pre test pre

li.p: testing a paragraph. That's a novel idea. well, if it is I should put it in <lq>.

li.note: testing a note, just a plain old note, not a special note

li.msgblock: test msgblock test msgblock test msgblock

li.lq: LQ: Darryl Strawberry was sentenced to 18 months in prison Monday for violating his probation on a 1999 conviction on drug and solicitation of prostitution charges.

li.lines: test lines test lines test lines
